new_posts.title: GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available
new_posts.summary: GitHub Copilot CLI—the terminal-native coding agent that brings the power of GitHub Copilot directly to your command line—is now generally available for all paid Copilot subscribers. Si

new_posts.title: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.20 release candidate is available
new_posts.summary: GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) 3.20 enhances deployment efficiency, monitoring capabilities, code security, and policy management. Here are a few highlights in the 3.20 release: The improved merge

new_posts.title: CodeQL adds Go 1.26 and Kotlin 2.3.10 support and improves query accuracy
new_posts.summary: CodeQL is the static analysis engine behind GitHub code scanning, which finds and remediates security issues in your code. We’ve released CodeQL 2.24.2, which adds support for Go 1.26 andR

new_posts.title: Dependabot can group updates by dependency name across multiple directories
new_posts.summary: Dependabot now supports grouping updates by dependency name across multiple directories, making it easier to manage dependency upgrades in repositories with more than one package or service. What&#

new_posts.title: GitHub Code Quality: Organization-level dashboard in public preview
new_posts.summary: GitHub Code Quality now includes an organization-level dashboard in public preview. It gives organization owners, administrators, and developers a view of code health across repositories where code

new_posts.title: Repository dashboard is now generally available
new_posts.summary: The repository dashboard is now generally available. Originally introduced in public preview, the dashboard makes it easy to find, filter, and save custom views of repositories you have access to.&

new_posts.summary:
Most multi-agent workflow failures come down to missing structure, not model capability. Learn the three engineering patterns that make agent systems reliable.

new_posts.title: Organization-level Copilot usage metrics dashboard available in public preview
new_posts.summary: Until now, Copilot usage metrics dashboards were only available at the enterprise level. With this release, organization owners can view GitHub Copilot usage metrics for their organization directly
